src.models package¶

Submodules¶

src.models.evaluate_model module¶

src.models.model_finetuning module¶

src.models.predict_model module¶

src.models.serve_model module¶

This module is used to deploy an API to request predictions from the model

src.models.serve_model.makecalc()¶

USES THE MODEL TO MAKE PREDICTIONS ON THE DATA SENT THROUGH THE API

Returns

list of the predictions

Return type

list

src.models.test_serving module¶

src.models.train_model module¶

src.models.utils_func module¶

This module offers util functions to be called and used in other modules

src.models.utils_func.generate_features_importance_plot(model, features, model_id)¶

GENERATES A PLOT DESCRIBING FEATURES IMPORTANCE FOR THE MODEL TO MAKE THE PREDICTION.

Parameters

  • model (tree-based model) – a tree based model (decision tree, random forest …)

  • features (pandas dataframe) – a table of the features on which we trained the model

  • model_id (str) – the unique id of the model

src.models.utils_func.id_generator(size=6, chars='abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789')¶

GENERATE A RANDOM STRING TO BE USED AS AN ID

Parameters

  • size (int, optional) – size of the string. Defaults to 6.

  • chars (str, optional) – charachters to be used to generate the string. Defaults to string.ascii_lowercase+string.digits.

Returns

a random chain of charachters

Return type

[str]

src.models.utils_func.plot_trees(rf, feature_names, target_names, model_id)¶

GENERATES A PLOT THAT SHOWS THE DECISION MAKING OF THE TREES

Parameters

  • rf (model) – a tree based model (random forest …)

  • feature_names (list) – names of the columns of the training set

  • target_names (str) – name of the target columns

  • model_id (str) – unique id of the model

src.models.utils_func.save_model(path, model)¶

SAVE MODEL INTO PICKLE FILE

Parameters

  • path (str) – path where to save the model

  • model (binary) – the model to be saved

src.models.utils_func.update_history(models_hist_path, model_id, model_name, model, params)¶

SAVE METADATA RELATED TO THE TRAINED MODEL INTO THE HISTORY FILE

Parameters

  • models_hist_path (str) – path to the history file

  • model_id (str) – unique id of the model

  • model_name (str) – model name = “model_”+model_id+”.pkl”

  • model (binary) – binary file of the model

  • params (dict) – dictionnary containing the hyper-parameters used to fit the model

src.models.utils_func.update_history_add_eval(models_hist_path, model_id=None, model_name=None, metrics=None)¶

ADD EVALUATION METRICS THE HISTORY FILE FOR THE SPECIFIED MODEL

Parameters

  • models_hist_path (str) – path to the history file

  • model_id (str, optional) – the id of the model. Defaults to None.

  • model_name (str, optional) – the name of the model. Defaults to None.

  • metrics (dict, optional) – a dictionnary containing metadata related to the model evaluation. Defaults to None.
